perturbation.original_text:
5.1   ebix shall pay to About, [**] in consideration for the Advertising
Impressions as set forth in Section 4.1  [ADVERTISING IMPRESSIONS; INTEGRATION IMP...], herein, no later than seven (7)
business days from the Effective Date , which shall be paid to About via wire
transfer, pursuant to the following instructions:[**]
perturbation.changed_text:
5.1   ebix shall pay to About, [**] in consideration for the Advertising
Impressions as set forth in Section 4.1  [ADVERTISING IMPRESSIONS; INTEGRATION IMP...], herein, no later than ninety (90)
business days from the Effective Date , which shall be paid to About via wire
transfer, pursuant to the following instructions:[**]
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies payment within seven business days. The modified text extends this to 90 business days. This creates a legal contradiction because standard business practice and potentially state-level prompt payment laws (depending on the specific nature of the advertising services) may mandate significantly shorter payment terms, making the 90-day term unreasonable and potentially unenforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of state-level prompt payment laws or general contract law principles regarding reasonable payment terms.  Specific laws vary by state (Illinois and New York are possibilities based on section 15.4, but unclear which would apply).

perturbation.original_text:
5.2 In addition, ebix agrees to pay to About a fee of [**] for [**] and [**]
from [**] up to [**] (the "Application Fees"). The payment of the Application
Fees are to be due within 30 days after the end of the month in which the
Application Fees were generated. Such payments shall be accompanied by a
report stating the number of Filled Application Forms generated during the
previous month, as well as the amount due to About. Ebix will track the
number of Filled Application Forms generated by About Customers.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.2 In addition, ebix agrees to pay to About a fee of [**] for [**] and [**]
from [**] up to [**] (the "Application Fees"). The payment of the Application
Fees are to be due within 90 days after the service. Such payments shall be accompanied by a
report stating the number of Filled Application Forms generated during the
previous month, as well as the amount due to About. Ebix will track the
number of Filled Application Forms generated by About Customers.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies payment within 30 days after the end of the month, while the change is 90 days after the service. It doesn't specify which month and extend the payment terms, making the 90-day term unreasonable and potentially unenforceable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of state-level prompt payment laws or general contract law principles regarding reasonable payment terms.  Specific laws vary by state (Illinois and New York are possibilities based on section 15.4, but unclear which would apply).

perturbation.original_text:
5.3   If any of the payments are not received on or before the appropriate dates
      as described above, About shall have the right to charge ebix interest on
      the overdue amount at the rate of 6% per year,, calculated from 30 days
      after the end of the month for which payment is made until the date of
      ebix's payment of such amount, which interest shall be in addition to such
      fees due and owing About. In addition, About shall be entitled to its
      reasonable costs and expenses (including attorneys' fees) in connection
      with any action to collect fees under or to otherwise enforce this
      Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.3   If any of the payments are not received on or before the appropriate dates
      as described above, About shall have the right to charge ebix interest on
      the overdue amount at the rate of 25% per year, calculated from the date for which payment is made until the date of
      ebix's payment of such amount, which interest shall be in addition to such
      fees due and owing About. In addition, About shall be entitled to its
      reasonable costs and expenses (including attorneys' fees) in connection
      with any action to collect fees under or to otherwise enforce this
      Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies interest at 6% per year. The modified text increases this to 25% per year. This creates a potential usury violation. Usury laws, which limit the maximum interest rate that can be charged on a loan or debt, vary by state. A rate of 25% may exceed the permissible limit in either Illinois or New York, or under federal law depending on the specific type of transaction and parties involved.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potential violation of state or federal usury laws.  Specific laws vary by state, including Illinois and New York. Federal law may also apply depending on the type of transaction.
